title: Instructional Design Scenarios for an Online Master’s Degree Program in Computer Science

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Advanced computer science education course based on online learning, focusing on acquiring practical skills through job-linked applications. Aims to deepen learner expertise via project-based assessments in blended environments

learning_goals: Learners master theoretical knowledge in core computer science domains (cloud computing, machine learning, cybersecurity) with over 80% comprehension
Learners design and implement team-based software projects solving real industrial problems, achieving at least 70 points on evaluation criteria

Learners perform real-time/asynchronous communication with peers and instructors using online collaboration tools (Slack, Microsoft Teams) at least twice weekly and achieve over 80% completion rates in learning community activities (e.g., assignment feedback, discussion initiations).

resources: Video Lecture Materials and Interactive Simulation Tools

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
